page.title: 01RICHBOROUGH CASTLE
page.content: {Richborough Castle}is a{Roman Fort} built late in the{3rd Century}on the highest land in this area, overlooking the{River Stour.}Most of its walls remain surrounded by ditches. It is administered by the{Department of the {Environment}and is supervised by a custodian who lives in a single storied house which also contains a small museum of Roman archeological finds. In 1985{Mrs Mary Drake}was custodian. Although the site is isolated and very bleak in winter, she did not mind the lonliness. The impressive walls of the castle, and the views from the site make this an unusual and interesting job.
